item.title: Creating Jobs
item.description:
How to Add a Job

Go to the Job List

Tap the Jobs Tab at the bottom. This will take you to the Job List for the Current Crew Member.

Tap the ‘Add Job’ Button

Tap the ’+’ Button in the top right. This will show the Add New Job Screen. This is where you set the Job Name, Production Company, Role, Department, Rate and Job Settings.

Enter Job Name and Production Company

You must enter a Job Name. Select a Production Company from the list. Tap the ’+’ Button in the toolbar to Add a New Production Company.

Production Companies are referred to as Clients in the Invoice Section of Crew Call.

Modify Role, Department or Rate If Required

These will be pre-filled based on the defaults in your Crew Profile. The most common value to modify is your rate as it’s likely you negotiate this on a job to job basis.

Add Job

Tap the Add Button in the bottom right. This will create a New Job and add it to the Job List for the Current Crew Member.

item.title: Creating Work Days
item.description:
There a two ways to create Work Days in Crew Call, Single and Multiple.

Single Work Days
This is a great approach when you are logging Work Days as you go. You open Crew Call when you’re on-set and create a Shoot Day.

Multiple Work Days
Many crew prefer to log their Work Days in advance. This option is ideal when you want to setup an entire Job in one go or if you are creating Work Days one week/multiple weeks at a time.

When using Calendar Sync, Crew Call will create calendar events that correspond to your Work Days. This is a great way to have your work schedule populate your day-to-day calendar.

Add a Single Work Day

Go to the Work Day List

Tap a Job in the Job List. This will load the Work Day List for that specific job.

Tap the ‘Add Work Day’ Button

Tap the ’+’ Button in the top right. This will show the Add Work Day Screen. Make sure that Single is selected at the top, this is used to create a Single Work Day.

Select the Date

Tap the Date up the top. This will open the Date Selection Popup. This is the date that will be used when creating the new Work Day.

Select ‘Half Day’ If Required

By default Work Days will be Full Days. If you are logging pre-production you can create a Half Day. This will enable your Half Day Rate for the new Work Day.

Swipe to Change Presets

Swiping on Pre Days, Shoot Days or Post Days will change the Date Title for the new Work Day. Choose from a number of commonly used Date Titles.

Add a Work Day

Tap on the Date Title Preset and a new Work Day will be created. You will return to the Work Day List.

Add Multiple Work Days

Go to the Work Day List

Tap a Job in the Job List. This will load the Work Day List for that specific job.

Tap the ‘Add Work Day’ Button

Tap the ’+’ Button in the top right. This will show the Add Work Day Screen. Make sure that Multiple is selected at the top, this is used to create Multiple Work Days.

Select the Date

Tap the Date up the top. This will open the Date Selection Popup. This is the start date that will be used when creating Multiple Work Days. Each time a new Work Day is created the date will increment, creating a sequence of new Work Days.

Skip Days

As Work Days are created in a sequence, sometimes you may wish to skip certain days. For example, you might be creating a 3 Week Job that shoots Mon-Fri, rather than creating three seperate weeks, you can create 15 Work Days at once and skip the weekends.

Select ‘Half Day’ If Required

By default Work Days will be Full Days. If you are logging pre-production you can create a Half Day. This will enable your Half Day Rate for the new Work Day.

Tap to Change Presets

Tapping on Pre Days, Shoot Days or Post Days will change the Date Title for the new Work Day. Choose from a number of commonly used Date Titles.

Add Multiple Work Days

Tap on the Add Button and a sequence of new Work Days will be created. You will return to the Work Day List.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description:
Onboarding

When you open Crew Call for the first time you will be guided through our onboarding process. This is an important step to help you start logging your work hours accurately.

Defaults

Crew Call uses defaults to make your life easier. The onboarding process will setup your defaults, these will be used whenever you create a new job going forward. Don’t worry if you get it wrong, these can be changed at any time. The two most important defaults are:

Overtime Calculation
This is used to breakdown your work day into different penalty rates such as 1.0x, 1.5x, 2.0x. It also determines your Daily Base Rate, if you charge for a 10 Hour Day, the Base Rate should be set as 10 Hours.

Rate
This is the Daily Rate that you charge for a job. Your Hourly Rate and Overtime Rates are automatically calculated from this value.

Start Logging Jobs

Once you have your Default Overtime Calculation and Rate setup, it’s time to start logging Jobs and Work Days.

item.title: Editing Jobs
item.description:
How to Edit a Job

Go to the Job List

Tap the Jobs Tab at the bottom. This will take you to the Job List for the Current Crew Member.

Select ‘Edit Job’

Tap and Hold on a Job. Select Edit Job from the menu.

Job Info

You can change the Job Name, Production Company, Role, Department or Rate. You can also mark jobs as Sent, Lock or Paid.

When you change your Rate for a Job and select Save, every Work Day for that Job will be re-calculated using the new rate.

Job Settings

Overtime Calculations, Overtime Rules, Night Loadings, Meal Penalties and Turnarounds can be modified on a job to job basis.

If you are working on a different scale of production or in a different country, you may want to change these so that your income is calculated correctly for that specific job.

When you change any of the Calculations and select Save, every Work Day for that Job will be re-calculated using the new Job Settings.

item.title: Logging Work Days
item.description:
When logging a Work Day there are three main sections, Labour, Equipment and Notes.

Labour

Labour is where you log your Call Time, Meal Breaks, Wrap Time and Travel. It displays a visual breakdown of your time worked and your income.

Labour
→

Equipment

Equipment is where you log any gear used on a particular shoot day. Total equipment earnings are displayed at the bottom. You can also apply discounts where required.

Equipment
→

Notes

Notes is where you’ll find everything else. You can write notes for a given shoot day. You can also log Locations and Chargeable Mileage. The bottom section let’s you record Camera Wrap and your Actual Drive Away Time.

Notes
→

Editing the Date Title

You can edit the Date Title by tapping it at the top of the Work Day Screen. By default, the presets you select when Creating a Work Day will be used for the Date Title.

Changing the Date

You can edit the Date by tapping it at the top of the Work Day Screen.

Navigating Work Days

Use the left/right arrows at the top of the Work Day Screen to change Work Days.

item.title: Labour
item.description:
Logging Times

Log your AM Travel, Call Time, Meal Break, Wrap Time and PM Travel using the selector. You can tap on the icon or the text to change your selection. The Time Slider will update depending on the value you have selected. Please note that Meal Breaks have two selections, Meal Start and Meal Length.

Time Slider

Use the time slider to adjust your times.

You can slide it left/right as you’d expect and the times will update. This is great when you need to quickly change the logged time.

You can also tap to the left/right and it will increment by 6/15 Mins. This is for when you need finer control.

Change the Time Increment via More Tab → Settings → Time Increment. You can select between 6 Min and 15 Min Increments.

Night Shoots

The best way to think about the Time Slider is that it represents 24 Hours of the Day. If you slide it to the right it’s later in the day, if you slide it to the left it’s earlier in the day.

To log a Night Shoot or Wrap Time after midnight, select Wrap Time and slide the Time Slider to the left to select 3:30am or whenever you finish. Crew Call knows that you’re logging a Night Shoot or a Day/Night and will process it as such. This assumes that your Call Time is already set to a time after 3:30am, for example a 4:00pm Call Time.

Once you’ve logged your times, double check your Meal Break as it may have been altered when you slid your Wrap Time to the start of the day.

Below is an example of a logged Night Shoot:

Second Meal Break

You can toggle between 1st Meal and 2nd Meal when you double tap on the Meal Break Icon in the selector.

Tap the 2nd Meal Button to enable a 2nd Meal Break. This tells Crew Call that a 2nd Meal is applicable for the current Work Day. You can then log Meal Start and Meal Length for the 2nd Meal Break as you normally would.

The times you enter for 1st Meal and 2nd Meal are used to calculate Meal Penalties.

Time Breakdown

The top section shows a Work Day Timeline, this is designed to give you a quick visual overview of the Work Day.

Teal is used for Travel.
Light Blue is used for Time Worked.
Dark Blue is used for Meal Breaks.

The bottom section breaks down Hours Worked based on your Overtime Calculation. You can see what hours were Single Time and how many hours you worked of 1.5x and 2.0x, etc.

Income Breakdown

The left section is a Pie Chart that gives you a visual overview of which penalties made up your income for the Work Day. The right section displays dollar values for each penalty.

The dollar value for LOAD in the right section is used for all Loadings that triggered additional income for this Work Day. This includes Night Loadings and Meal Penalties.

If you tap on a section of the Pie Chart it will highlight the corresponding penalty and income earned for that penalty.

Work Day Popups

The very bottom section of the Labour Screen is for Work Day Popups. Each button represents a modificaton to Work Day Income.

When a button is highlighted that means the corresponding modifier is active. Tap any of these buttons to show a popup which provides more information.

Flat Rate

Flat Rate is disabled by default, this means the Work Day will use the Overtime Calculation for Labour Income.

When enabled, the Work Day will use the Flat Rate for it’s income. Any penalty rates and overtime that is normally calculated will be ignored. This is often used for Travel Days or when production has negotiated a fixed rate with you for a job. Flat Rate can be changed on a day-to-day basis by entering a different value into the Text Field.

Best practice is to enter the Flat Rate that you will use most often and tap Set As Default Flat Rate. Once a default has been set, any new Work Day that you create will have this Flat Rate assigned. All you need to do is enable it.

Flat Rate can be changed on a day-to-day basis by entering a different value into the Text Field. Tap the Flat Rate Button to reset the current value to your Default Flat Rate.

Half Day Rate

Half Day Rate is used to charge a percentage of your Labour Rate for the current Work Day. Your Labour Rate is set when Editing a Job.

Setting a Default Half Day Rate and resetting the current value works the same as Flat Rate. Please read the Flat Rate Section above for reference.

If your Half Day Rate does not calculate as you would expect, please check More Tab → Settings → Half Day Rounding. This setting determines if the percentage rounds up or down.

Daily Bump

Daily Bump is used when a crew member needs to step up within their department for a single day. For example, a 2nd AC may work as a 1st AC on a 3rd Camera Day, thus their Day Rate needs to change just for this shoot day to match their new role and responsibility.

Enable Daily Bump and set a different Role and Rate. The Overtime Calculation for the Job will still be used, it will just be calculated using the Daily Bump Rate instead.

Setting a Default Daily Bump and resetting the current Daily Bump works the same as Flat Rate. Please read the Flat Rate Section above for reference.

Minimum Work Day

If you work a day that is shorter than the Minimum Work Day, you charge the for the minimum amount of hours worked rather than for the actual hours worked.

In the example below, the crew member worked 5.5 Hours but they were booked on an 8 Hour Rate. The Minimum Work Day is 8 Hours so they charge for 8 Hours even though they only worked 5.5 Hours.

Minimum Work Day is set via Job Settings when Editing a Job. It can be disabled if you wish to only charge for hours worked.

Overtime Rules

Overtime Rules are used when different penalties are applicable based on the day of the week. This can be 6th Day and 7th Day Penalties or things like 2.0x on Sundays. They will trigger automatically if the Work Day meets the criteria for a given rule.

The Overtime Rules Popup gives you a breakdown of how penalties have changed. In the example below, it shows that 1.0x is changed to 2.0x for 8 Hours which results in $750.00 more income earned.

The Income Breakdown will display RULE for the income earned based on Overtime Rules. It will also display a green dot next to penalties that have been modified by an Overtime Rule.

Overtime Rules are set via Job Settings when Editing a Job.

Tap the button in the top left of the popup if you want to Ignore a Penalty. Income earned from the Overtime Rule will be ignored until you Stop Ignoring the Penalty.

Night Loadings

Night Loadings are triggered when your Start Time or Finish Time overlaps with the times set for a Night Loading Calculation.

Income earned from a Night Loading considers your Current Penalty (1.0x, 1.5x, 2.0x) and will add additional income to match what is specified in the Night Loading Calculation.

Night Loadings are set via Job Settings when Editing a Job.

Tap the button in the top left of the popup if you want to Ignore Night Loadings. Income earned from Night Loadings will be ignored until you Stop Ignoring Night Loading.

Meal Penalties

The Meal Start and Meal Length of your 1st Meal and 2nd Meal are checked against the Meal Penalty Calculation. If a Delayed Meal Break or Short Meal Break is detcted, the corresponding penalty will be automatically applied.

Meal Penalties are set via Job Settings when Editing a Job.

Tap the button in the middle of the popup if you want to Ignore Meal Penalties. You can ignore 1st Meal and 2nd Meal seperately. Income earned from Meal Penalties will be ignored until you Stop Ignoring Meal Penalties.

Turnarounds

Crew Call will automatically check your Turnaround Times to make sure you are getting an appropriate break between Work Days. It will calculate the hours between your Finish Time on one day and your Start Time the next day.

If your Turnaround Time is too short it will flag that you have Broken Turnaround. The duration of each Turnaround is defined by the Turnaround Calculation.

Next Day Turnaround is used day to day.
One Day Turnaround is used when shooting a 6 Day Week.
Two Day Turnaround is used when shooting a 5 Day Week.

Crew Call knows which Turnaround to apply based on Work Days that have been logged in the current, previous and next Work Weeks.

Tap the control in the top right of the Turnaround Popup to toggle between Broken Turnarounds and Future Turnarounds.

Future Turnarounds will tell you your Next Day, One Day and Two Day Turnaround Times for the Current Work Day. This allows you to easily check when you can start the next day if production ask you to start on turnaround.

Turnarounds are set via Job Settings when Editing a Job.

Tap the button at the bottom of the popup if you want to Ignore Turnarounds. Currently there is no income earned from Broken Turnarounds in Crew Call, the ignore option is only used to disable the highlight indicating that you have Broken Tunraround.

item.title: Equipment
item.description:
Logging Equipment

Tap the Equipment List to log gear that was used on the current Work Day.

Equipment Items are organised by category and can be added and edited via the Home Tab → Crew Profile → Equipment List.

Equipment Items can have varying quantities. Sometimes you own a single unit and sometimes you have multiple units of the same piece of gear.

Single Equipment Items
These are toggled on/off with a tap.

Multiple Equipment Items
These are modified with the stepper. Tap the stepper to increment or reduce the number of units that have been used.

Day Rate or Weekly Rate

Each Equipment Item displays a D or a W next to it.

D indicates that the Day Rate is being used.
W indicates that the Weekly Rate is being used.

Tap and Hold on an Equipment Item to swap between using a Day Rate and a Weekly Rate. When using a Weekly Rate, the Work Week will be calculated using based on More Tab → Settings → First Day of Week.

Discounts

The bottom section displays the Job Discount. This as a global discount that will be applied to every Work Day created for this Job.

Tap the +/- Stepper to increase or reduce the discount percent. The amount discounted and your earnings after discount will be automatically calculated and displayed.

Discount Categories

By default the Job Discount will apply to all Equipment Categories. This can be changed so that the discount is only applied to Equipment Items in certain categories.

This is useful if you need to apply a discount to everything except for certain Equipment Items. In the example above, all of the Data Management and Misc Equipment is discounted but we do not apply any discount to Vehicles.

Equipment Override

Swipe Left on any Equipment Item and select Edit to apply an Equipment Override.

Equipment Override allows you to change the Day Rate or Weekly Rate for a specific Equipment Item without impacting its price on other Jobs.

Use the text field to change the price of an Equipment Item. If you need to Calculate by Percentage you can use the +/- Stepper that is positioned above the keyboard.

Equipment Overrides can be applied to the Entire Job or just the Current Work Day.

Use Entire Job if the discount or surcharge you wish to apply needs to be used on every Work Day logged for this Job.

Use Current Work Day if the discount or surcharge will change from day to day. This is useful for logging expenses which is detailed below.

There will be a pink dot next to the Equipment Item when an Equipment Override is applied.

To remove an Equipment Override, Swipe Left and select Edit, then tap Delete Override.

Expenses

There is no offical support for expenses within Crew Call but you can achieve similar functionality using Equipment Items and Equipment Overrides.

Many crew will setup an Equipment Category called Expenses. They will then add various Equipment Items that match common expenses, these have a Day Rate of $0.00.

When you log Per Diems you will need to apply an Equipment Override and set it’s Day Rate to the amount of Per Diems you are entitled to for that day.

It’s important to make sure you select Current Work Day when you create the Equipment Override as the amount you charge for Per Diems will differ from day-to-day.

Once the Equipment Override has been created you will be charging the correct amount for the expense. This process is repeated for every day that you need to be reimbursed for an expense.

Daily/Weekly Breakdown

Switch between a Daily Breakdown and Weekly Breakdown using the toggle in the top right. This is useful to keep track of how much Equipment Income you are earning each day or week.

item.title: Notes
item.description:
Notes

Use the Notes Section to keep track of anything that may come up. Notes are tied to a specific Work Day and can be easily checked later on.

When creating PDF Reports or Timesheets you can choose if these Work Day Notes are included or not. It’s up to you if you make these notes production friendly or if they contain things you want to keep to yourself.

Logging Locations

Add Locations to a Work Day to keep track of where you are shooting. When you have location moves, Crew Call can help you navigate by opening the Next Location in your Preferred Map Application.

Logged Locations will automatically calculate Driving Estimates which can be exported as a Driving Logbook for tax purposes.

When using Calendar Sync, the first Logged Location will be added to the corresponding Calendar Event in your iOS or Google Calendar.

Learn more about Logging Locations:

Locations
→

Logging Chargeable Mileage

Milage is used for Paid KMs or Miles that you charge to production. Mileage can be logged manually or you can use the Auto Calculate Mileage feature.

Learn more about Chargeable Mileage:

Mileage
→

Camera Wrap

This can be used when you want to record the exact time of Camera Wrap. This can be helpful infomation to have on hand when discussing things with production in the future.

Tap the Camera Wrap Button to log the current time as Camera Wrap.

Tap and Hold the Camera Wrap Button and select Set Manually to dial in the exact time.

Tap and Hold the Camera Wrap Button and select Delete Camera Wrap to remove it.

Drive Away

Often the Drive Away Time and the Wrap Time will differ slightly as crew typically round up their Wrap Time to the nearest 6/15 Minutes. Drive Away allows you to record your actual drive away time for future reference.

When you log Camera Wrap and Drive Away you Bump Out time is calculated automatically. This can useful to know how long it took you to wrap out of a location.

Drive Away works the exact same way as Camera Wrap, please refer to the information above.

When you tap Drive Away, you will be presented with some options if you have set a Home Location. Lock Work Day & Navigate Home is used most often as it will sign off the Work Day and open your Preferred Map Application and start navigating you home.

item.title: Locations
item.description:
Summary and Settings

Location Summary is used to Add Locations.

Location Settings is used to set Home Locations and a Base Location.

Driving Estimates calculate time and mileage between your Home Location and any locations that you log. Below we’ll show you how to get setup.

Default Home Location

When using Locations for the first time, it’s best to set your Default Home Location.

Tap ‘Home Location • AM’

This will open the Add Location Screen.

Type in Home Address

This should be the location where you normally wake up and where you go home to in the evening. Crew Call will use this to calculate the distance between Home and any Shooting Locations that you log.

Select the Home Address

Select your Home Location from the list of addresses and tap the Done Button at the bottom.

Set as Default

Tap and Hold on Home Location • AM and select Set As Default. Any new Work Days that you create from this point forward will now have the Home Location set automatically.

Default Base Location

When using Locations for the first time, it’s best to set your Default Base Location.

Tap ‘Base Location’

This will open the Add Location Screen.

Type in City Address

This should be the location of the main city where you normally work. Crew Call will use this to calculate if any Shooting Locations fall outside of the zone.

Select the City Address

Select your Base Location from the list of addresses and tap the Done Button at the bottom. It doesn’t need to have a full street address, just the city is fine.

Set as Default

Tap and Hold on Base Location and select Set As Default. Any new Work Days that you create from this point forward will now have the Base Location set automatically.

Home Locations

By default, Home Location • PM will be identical to Home Location • AM. The only time you need to change these is when you’re doing an away job.

Change the Home Location to be your accomodation when working away and Crew Call will calculate your Driving Estimates accordingly.

Base Location and Radius

The Base Location is the main city where you work. Most places will charge mileage and travel time when you work a certain distance outside of the Base Location.

In Melbourne, Australia we use a 20km Radius from Melbourne City. My Base Location is set as per above and my Base Radius is set to 20km. Base Radius can be

Base Radius can be changed from day-to-day. Tap and Hold and select Set As Default if you are moving onto a new job that uses a different Base Radius, any Work Days you create after this will use this New Default.

You can change between Kilometers and Miles via More Tab → Settings → Mileage Format.

Add Location

From the Location Summary Screen, tap Add Location. This will open the Add Location Screen. There are three different ways to add a location:

Current Location

This will use your current location based on your device’s GPS. This requires Location Permissions from iOS in order to work. Whenever the Add Location Screen shows this will be used as a default. This is handy if you are adding a location while you’re on-set.

Search Locations

Type in an address and relevant locations will display in the list. Tap the location in the list to select it. This is the easiest way to add locations in advance.

Visited Before

Select from a list of locations that you have visted before. If you find yourself working in the same location week after week, this is the fastest way to log it.

Location List

Once you have added all of the locations for a Work Day you will see them as a list in the Location Summary.

Reorder Locations

Tap the Reorder Button to the right of Driving Estimates if you need to reorder locations. You may have entered them in the incorrect order or shooting plans may have changed.

Driving Estimate

Crew Call will calculate a Driving Estimate for the locations you travelled to during the Work Day. It will navigate from Home AM → Location 01 → Other Logged Locations → Home PM. The driving route will be drawn on the map as you can see below.

Driving Estimates will calculate a Duration and Distance. Home AM → Location 01 will take your Call Time into consideration as this impacts traffic. Last Location → Home PM will take your Wrap Time into consideration in the same way.

Estimates may vary depending on the route taken. If you have Estimates Use Tolls enabled, Duration and Distance may be shorter as toll routes are typically faster and shorter.

Navigate to Locations

Tap and Hold on a location in the Location Summary Screen and select Navigate.

The first time you use this feature you will be asked to choose a Preferred Map Application.

You can change Preferred Map Application via More Tab → Settings → Preferred Map Application.

You can also navigate to locations from the Work Day List. Tap and Hold on a Work Day and select Navigate To… → Location. The Navigate To… option will only be visible is a Work Day has logged locations.

item.title: Mileage
item.description:
Summary and Rate

Mileage Summary is used to Add Mileage.

Mileage Rate is used to modify the dollar amount charged per KM or Mile.

Add Mileage

Tap ‘Add Mileage’

Tap Add Mileage in the Mileage List and you’ll be presented with the Mileage Popup.

Enter Your Locations

Enter your Start Location and End Location using the text fields.

Enter Chargeable Distance

Use the Mileage Slider to enter your Chargeable Distance. Slide to change values quickly. Tap to the left/right to move in smaller increments.

Tap the ‘Add Button’

Tap the Add Button and the Mileage will be added to the Mileage List.

Mileage Distance Options

When you are manually editing the Mileage Distance you have some options to make entering the precise value easier.

Distance Increment
Change between 1km / 0.1km increments. The Mileage Slider will use the selected increment. When using Miles the increment will be 1mi / 0.1mi.

Distance Range
Change the range of the Mileage Slider.
Small is 0km - 200km.
Medium is 200km - 500km.
Large is 500km - 1000km.

When using Miles the ranges will use Miles instead of KMs.

You can change between Kilometers and Miles via More Tab → Settings → Mileage Format.

Edit Mileage

Tap Existing Mileage in the Mileage List to edit it. The process is the same as Adding Mileage. Make sure you tap the Save Button when you are finished making changes.

Auto Calculate Mileage

If you use the Location Features you will be able to take advantage of Auto Calculate Mileage. This will check each Location that you have logged and assess if it is outside of the Base Radius. If it falls outside of the Base Radius it will calculate the Chargeable Mileage for that location.

All you need to do to use this feature is:

  1. Add a Base Location
  2. Log Locations
  3. Tap Auto Calculate Mileage

It will take a moment to calculate mileage. An internet connection is required.

When finished you will have Chargeable Mileage for all location moves that are outside of the Base Radius for the Selected Work Day.

The distance is calculated by navigating from your Base Location to the Logged Location, the Base Radius will be subtracted from this distance.

In the example below, the distance from Melbourne to Woodend is 72km and our Base Radius is 20km, thus the Chargeable Mileage is 52km (72km - 20km).

If you exit the Base Radius and travel to various locations outside of the radius, Crew Call will calculate the distance from Location 01 → Location 02. Each location is assessed independantly to determine if it is outside of the Base Radius.

Away Jobs

When you’re on an away job it’s typical to charge mileage back to your accomodation. If you set your Home Locations, Crew Call will know you’re on an away job and Chargeable Mileage will be calculated automatically.

If the Home Locations logged for a Work Day differ from your Default Home Location the system will assume you’re doing an away job.

Home AM and Home PM are calculated independently so this functionality will work when you leave for an away job and when you return home from an away job.

Disclaimer

Just a quick reminder to always double check the Chargeable Mileage calculated by Crew Call before you bill production.

Any mileage calculated using Auto Calculate Mileage can be edited.

Mileage Rate

Tap the Dollar Button in the top right to show the Mileage Rate Screen.

The Mileage Rate can be changed for each Work Day, this is useful if you use different vehicles throughout a job. You may use a van one day and charge $1.50/km and then use a truck the next day and charge $2.50/km.

Tap the Set Default Button to set the Default Mileage Rate for the current Crew Member. New Work Days that are created from this point forward will use this value as the Mileage Rate. It’s best to set this up before creating too many Work Days so the $/km is always what you expect it to be.

item.title: Lock Work Days
item.description:
Lock Button

Tap the Lock Button in the top right corner to Lock/Unlock a Work Day.

You can’t change Labour, Equipment, Notes, Locations or Mileage on a Locked Work Day. Enable this at the end of each day to prevent accidental changes.

Often you’ll want to browse a Logged Work Day, if it’s locked you don’t need to worry about accidentally changing something important.

Lock Work Weeks

If every Work Day within a Work Week is locked it will be displayed as Locked in the Work Day List. Work Days that fall within a Locked Work Week can not be deleted.

Tap and Hold on any Work Day in the Work Day List to Lock/Unlock an entire Work Week at once. This is a quick and easy way to sign off an entire week to ensure no accidental changes are made when browsing later.

Lock Jobs

Use the Lock Button to Lock/Unlock an Entire Job from the Edit Job Screen.

Jobs can also be Locked/Unlocked from the Job List. Tap and Hold and select Mark As → Locked.
